Class BoardRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.BoardRenderer
public class BoardRenderer extends Object
Renders the game board and falling bricks using JavaFX components. Manages the visual representation of the game board, current falling brick, ghost piece preview, and handles color mapping for different brick types.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    BoardRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel)
    Constructs a BoardRenderer with the specified game and brick panels.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardRenderer

      public BoardRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel)
      Constructs a BoardRenderer with the specified game and brick panels.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the GridPane for rendering the game board
      brickPanel - the GridPane for rendering the falling brick

  • Method Details

    • initBoard

      public void initBoard(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Initializes the game board display by creating rectangles for each cell. Only displays rows starting from index 2 (hides the top 2 rows used for spawning).
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the initial game board matrix

    • initPreview

      public void initPreview(ViewData brick)
      Initializes the preview display for the falling brick. Creates rectangles for the brick shape and positions it on the board.
      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData containing the initial brick information

    • refreshPreview

      public void refreshPreview(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the preview display with updated brick data. Updates the brick's position, appearance, and renders the ghost piece.
      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData containing updated brick information

    • refreshBoard

      public void refreshBoard(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the game board display with the updated board matrix. Updates the colors of all cells based on the new board state.
      Parameters:
      board - the updated game board matrix

    • renderGhost

      public void renderGhost(ViewData brick)
      Renders the ghost piece that shows where the current brick will land. Clears any previous ghost piece and creates a new semi-transparent ghost at the calculated landing position.
      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData containing brick and ghost position information
